item.title: Planet Observer
item.body: Come to the Museum and make a virtual trip around the world in order to discover both the endangered and the thriving species. Take a passport: its 26 questions will lead you along the different halls where you can search for the right answers. Experience our collection in a playful and biodiverse way.
item.address: Muséum des Sciences Naturelles de Belgique r. Vautier 29/Museum voor Natuurwetenschappen Vautierstr. 29

item.title: 1001 Repères
item.address: Musée des Enfants r. du Bourgmestre 15/Kindermuseum Burgemeesterstr. 15

item.title: Brussels in watercolor
item.body: From 3 December 2010 to 31 December 2011 at the Museum of the City of Brussels - Maison du Roi.Exhibition Brussels in watercolor, a snapshot 1894-1897, Jacques Carabain. Before the time of photography, artists were invited to make a portrait of the city.Between 1894 and 1897 the painter Jacques Carabain made 59 watercolor paintings of Brussels: ancient neighborhoods, many small passages, an international port and industry within the city walls.
item.address: Musée de la Ville de Bruxelles - Maison du Roi Grand-Place/Museum van de Stad Brussel - Broodhuis Grote Markt

item.title: Horta, a lost world - Horta 2011
item.body: The exhibition at the Autrique residence puts a number of decisive moments in the architectural career of Victor Horta in the spotlights. Horta, who loved his realisations as if they were his children, saw many of the buildings being taken down.One can barely fathom how an oeuvre so highly spoken of at the time, and internationally acclaimed because of the technical ingenuity ánd of the top quality materials used, would fall into disgrace only a few years later.Only about 100 years after the style was introduced did the Art Nouveau experience a renaissance. The story of the style could even be seen as a modern fairy tale.
item.address: Maison Autrique chée de Haecht 266/Autriquehuis Haachtsestwg. 266

item.title: Bob De Moor and the sea
item.body: In 1956, two remarkable men boarded the freighter, the Reine Astrid, for a fact-finding cruise inthe North Sea. This was how Hergé and Bob De Moor did the preparatory work for the publicationof the Tintin story The Red Sea Sharks. Over and above his very important collaboration withHergé which was part of his life from 1950, Bob De Moor (1925-1992) produced a rich and originalbody of work that is one of the most significant in European comic strip, while at the same timeremaining faithful to his Antwerp and maritime roots.
item.address: Centre belge de la Bande Dessinée (CBBD) r. des Sables 20/Belgisch Stripcentrum Zandstr. 20

item.title: Coudenberg-Former Palace of Brussels
item.body: During a fascinating walk under the pavements of the Place Royale you will discover the remains of the Coudenberg palace which was one of Charles V's main residences. The former Hoogstraeten mansion - and its magnificent Gothic gallery - now completely restored - houses the Coudenberg Museum. The best of the archeological finds, discovered during various digs over the last 25 years are exhibited here and reveal the history of the Coudenberg........
item.address: Coudenberg - Ancien Palais de Bruxelles Place des Palais 7 /Coudenberg - Voormalig Palais van Brussel Paleizenstr. 7

item.title: L'Ecole hollandaise
item.address: Musées royaux des Beaux-Arts de Belgique r. de la Régence 3/Koninklijke Musea voor Schone Kunsten van België Regentschapsstr. 3

item.title: Sculpture Undone, 1955 – 1972
item.body: This expansive survey of Polish sculptor Alina Szapocznikow (1926–1973) coincides with the Polish presidency of the European Union and is one of the first major solo exhibitions of the artist's work outside of Poland. It concentrates on her most experimental period from the 1960s and 1970s, before her untimely death at age 47. As a Holocaust survivor who began working in the post-war period in a rather classical, figurative manner, her later experimentation and re-conception of sculpture left behind a legacy of provocative objects – at once sexualized, visceral, humorous, and political – that sit uneasily between Surrealism, Nouveau Realism, and Pop Art. Her tinted polyester-resin casts of her lips and breasts transformed into quotidian objects like lamps or ashtrays, her spongy polyurethane forms often embedded with casts of bellies or live grass, and her construction of resin sculptures that incorporate found photographs remain as remarkably biting, visionary, and original today as when they were first made. The exhibition will privilege all of the media Szapocznikow worked in, including photography and drawing alongside her sculpture and object-making.
item.address: Wiels - Centre d'art contemporain asbl av. Van Volxem 354/Wiels - Centrum voor Hedendaagse Kunst vzw Van Volxemlaan 354

item.title: club.brasil
item.body:
Following the success of the Tea House during europalia.china, the Mont des Arts/Kunstberg willagain host the information centre of Europalia, as well as Brazilian venue. As a documentationcentre, restaurant, bar and arts centre, the club.brasil will display all facets of Brazil, as a foretasteof the festival programme. Be prepared for some sun and Brazilian alegria in the middle of the Belgianwinter.

Programme

Every weekend, the club.brasil will host a series of free events, concerts, dance lessons,art workshops or street arts. Every week, following different themes, the programme will presentthe multiple aspects of Brazilian culture: samba, street and electronic music, bossa nova, jazz orinstrumental music, Sertão or north-eastern rhythms... club.brasil will immerse you in the heart ofBrazilian diversity.

Concerts:

Friday at 8.30 pm

Dance:

Saturday at 5 pm

Creative workshops:

Sunday at 3 pm

Opening Party:

18.09.2011 from 2 pm to 6 pm

On carfree Sunday, the Kunstberg/Mont des Arts will highlight Bahia and provide an afternoon ofopen air events: batucada concerts, creation of musical instruments, Afro-Brazilian dance, capoeirademonstrations, local specialty tasting and much more!
item.address: Bâtiment Dynastie Mont des Arts/Dynastiegebouw Kunstberg

item.title: Henri-Jean Closon (1888-1975), peintre belge à Montparnasse
item.address: Musée René Magritte (Jette) r. Esseghem 135/René Magritte Museum (Jette) Esseghemstr. 135

item.title: Poland in focus
item.body: Poland takes over the presidency of the Council of the European Union on 1 July. BOZAR will mark the Polish presidency this autumn with an eclectic programme focusing on Polish music, literature, and per-forming arts.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Nocturnes des Musées bruxellois 2011
item.body: Spending your evening in a museum certainly makes a change from working up a sweat on a dance floor or going to a concert. Every autumn Thursday a number of Brussels museums stay open late, with guided tours and rare opportunities to talk to curators and see behind the scenes.
item.address: Divers musées de Bruxelles /Verschillende musea van Brussel

item.title: George Simenon, the journey of a Belgian Writer
item.body: Born in Liège on 12 February 1903 and deceased in Lausanne on 4 September 1989, Simenon was a journalist and the author, under some 25 nicknames, of 176 popular novels and of more than 200 novels, 155 short stories and 25 autobiographical texts under his real name. He owes his fame among the general public to his detective stories, and particularly to the Commissaire Maigret who, from 1931 to 1972, carries his negligent and rude insight through 75 novels and 28 short stories, outshining a little bit on the way a work with a unique tone.The exhibition of the Museum of letters and manuscripts outlines, on a chronological way, the life and the work of Georges Simenon, in eight parts: "A childhood in Liège and the departure to Paris", "Georges Simenon and Liège", "Georges Simenon and Tigy Renchon", "Georges Simenon and Maigret", "Georges Simenon and the post-war years", "Georges Simenon and the writing", "Georges Simenon, America and Denyse Ouimet" and "Georges Simenon and his return to Europe".
item.address: MLM - Musée des Lettres et des Manuscrits Galerie du Roi 3/MLM - Museum der Letteren en manuscripten Koningsgalerij 3

item.title: The history of Sabena
item.address: Musées royaux d'Art et d'Histoire - Musée du Cinquantenaire (MRAH) Parc du Cinquantenaire 10/Koninklijke Musea voor Kunst en Geschiedenis - Jubelparkmuseum (KMKG) Jubelpark 10

item.title: Flemish miniatures
item.address: Bibliothèque royale de Belgique Mont des Arts - bd. de l'Empereur 2/Koninklijke Bibliotheek van België Kunstberg - Keizersln. 2

item.title: Skoda Jazz Festival 2011
item.body: The jazz festival is part of the top three in Europe. The impressive list of artists who have performed there speaks for itself: Miles Davis, Ray Charles, Chet Baker, Sonny Rollins, Branford Wynton Marsalis, Oscar Peterson, Ornette Coleman, Art Blakey, Dave Brubeck, Chick Corea, Herbie Hancock, Wayne Shorter, Michel Petrucciani, Nina Simone, Cesaria Evora, Archie Shepp, Philip Catherine, Toots, Keith Jarrett ...
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: europalia.brasil
item.body:
From 4th October 2011 until 15th January 2012, europalia.brasil intends to put on display a current and little-known Brazil with diversity as its central theme. Modern and forward-looking, Brazil has managed to draw upon its origins and the mosaic of its peoples. An entire world blends together in this country : from the heirs of European settlers to the Amazon Indians, from the Afro-Brazilians – descendants of slaves – to immigrants from Japan, Lebanon, Italy, China, Germany… At the crossroads of all these cultures you will find Brazilian culture in its multiple facets !
 
 
A team of innovative Brazilian curators are currently working to set up some twenty exhibitions charting the fascinating history of Brazilian art, from the first inhabitants of Brazil up to contemporary and future upcoming talents.
 
For the disciplines of music, dance and theatre, europalia.brasil will focus primarily on the contemporary art scene, while evoking the traditional roots.
 
Through various mini-festivals, conferences, workshops and residencies, the film and literature programmes will highlight history and the present.
 
The club.brasil, located on the Mont des Arts, will be the epicentre of the festival. It will host the information point of the festival, as well as a shop, a restaurant, a bar and a venue for a programme of Brazilian performances and workshops.
.
item.address: Divers lieux en Belgique /Verschillende locaties in Belgïe

item.title: The age of impressionism in Romania, Nicolae Grigorescu (1838-1907)
item.address: Hôtel de Ville Grand-Place/Stadhuis Brussel Grote Markt

item.title: Senses! Explore the senses of man and animal
item.body: Feel free to look, and please DO touch! This interactive exhibition explores the human and animal senses. Seeing, hearing, feeling, tasting and smelling... it's a real delight!Our senses determine how we perceive the world and how we should respond to external stimuli. Find out which frequencies you can hear and if you can recognize different odours. Take a look at your taste buds under the microscope and discover which parts of your body are more sensitive than others.All our senses seem to function very well, but compared to animals we are actually quite limited in our perception of the world around us. Look beyond the end of your nose and discover how some animals rely on senses that are far more developed than ours ... or even have senses that we can hardly imagine! Find out how good you are at locating nectar using UV light like bees do, and imitate a bat catching moths with the help of echolocation. Or would you prefer to try sniffing out drugs along with police dog Thor? Can you match chimpanzees in finding tasty berries under various light conditions? Have you always wanted to know what it feels like to be a snake, hunting rats using infrared heat waves? After doing these experiments, you will see these animals in a different light.Senses! A sensory experience for families with children from 6 years onwards, with a special route for toddlers (3-6 years).
item.address: Muséum des Sciences Naturelles de Belgique r. Vautier 29/Museum voor Natuurwetenschappen Vautierstr. 29

item.title: Extremes. Fotografia historica y contemporanea. (europalia.brasil)
item.body: This exhibition will present Brazilian photography in all its diversity. From the earliest photographsand historic discoveries to the most recent contemporary trends.Artists for the historical part (1840-1940): Christiano Junior, Joaquim Insley Pacheco, Marc Ferrez,Revert Henrique Klumb, George Leuzinger, Juan Gutierrez ...Artists for the contemporary part: Luiz Braga, Claudia Andujar, Gustavo Lacerda, Thiago Santana,Araquém Alcântara ...
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Of gold and feathers. (europalia.brasil)
item.body: While they are all based on the idea of scarcity, value and payment systems are nevertheless not universal. Brazil has some striking examples of this. One and the same environment – the Amazon Basin, for instance – has long been subject to different perceptions by different groups of people. The Amerindian people who have lived there for thousands of years based their exchanges on the rarity of the brightly coloured feathers of certain birds, which in turn would be at the heart of a complex web of economic, social and symbolic relations. In search of the new Eldorado, the settlers were not interested in these feathers, but instead were looking for the gold swept along by the sludge in the rivers and watercourses, this gold that has historically been intimately linked with the rapid expansion of the trading economy and western capitalism. Even today, this precious metal fever lives on in the hearts of the gold washers (garimpeiros) who venture into the Amerindian territories of the Amazon, with high social and environmental costs.
item.address: Musée de la Banque Nationale de Belgique r. du Bois Sauvage 10/Museum van de Nationale Bank van België Wildewoudstr. 10

item.title: Art in Brazil (1950-2011) (europalia.brasil)
item.body: In the late 1940s, there was a growing demand for a system to determine what was and what wasnot modern in Brazilian art. Modernism could not provide the answer; it had become too local and nolonger provided any conventions or aesthetic definitions. In 1952, the Grupo Ruptura was establishedin São Paulo and with their rationally structured, geometrical abstract works, these artists distancedthemselves from the regional, obligatory Brazilian iconography and social critique of the Modernists.The Grupo Ruptura called itself the first Brazilian avant-garde movement.This exhibition traces the evolution of Brazilian art from the 1950s until the present day and is thefirst exhibition in Europe to address this from a Brazilian and not a predominantly Western perspective.There are four chronological modules in the exhibition: the 1950s, the decade 1960-70, the1980s, and the 1990s until today. These modules are interspersed with sections that explore the workof specific artists in more detail, including Alfredo Volpi, and the Brazilian context – for example, therole of architecture in the period of the dictatorship (1964-1985) – in which the art developed.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Indios no Brasil. (europalia.brasil)
item.body: Works testifying of the mystery and sophistication of the art and material culture of Brazilian Indian populations have never before been shown in Europe. Much of the exhibition will be devoted to almost two hundred brightly coloured feather ornaments, decorations and objects of everyday life which are beautifully crafted and whose colours and execution are bound to make an impression on visitors. To reveal the immense variety of their lifestyles, the Indian groups will be put together according to their natural habitat: the coast, the plain, the forest and the river. Major archaeological discoveries and cave paintings testifying of the rich pre-Columbian past and the construction of an Indian imaginary in Europe will complement the exhibition. Drawings and objects brought back from famous and less famous expeditions tell of how the immense natural diversity of Brazil and the Indians who lived there were revealed to the West. Particular attention will also be paid to more current issues While a vast majority of Indians are increasingly 7 integrating into modern Brazilian society, some Indian groups still live virtually isolated and have little or no contact with the outside world.
item.address: Musées royaux d'Art et d'Histoire - Musée du Cinquantenaire (MRAH) Parc du Cinquantenaire 10/Koninklijke Musea voor Kunst en Geschiedenis - Jubelparkmuseum (KMKG) Jubelpark 10

item.title: Incorporations. Afro-Brazilian Contemporary Art
item.body: Incorporation will show the pervasiveness of spirituality in contemporary Afro-Brazilian art and how it grew from being a mere folkloric performance into a way of affirming religious values. In this context, some groups of artists work on the links with Africa, while others see art as a tool of political emancipation.Artists: Rubem Valentim, Cravo Neto, Emanoel Araújo, Rosana Paulino, Pierre Verger, Ayrson Heráclito.
item.address: La Centrale Electrique/European Center for Contemporary Art pl. Ste.-Catherine 44/De Elektriciteitscentrale/European Center for Contemporary Art Sint-Katelijneplein 44

item.title: De la lumière à la couleur.Rik Wouters et contemporains.
item.address: Dexia Banque Bd Pachéco 44/Dexia Bank Pachecoln. 44

item.title: Terra Brasilis (europalia.brasil)
item.body: The exhibition develops the reciprocal influence between Europe and Brazil in the discovery, appreciation and exploitation of Brazilian flora and fauna. This unique interaction between the two continents, centred on the natural resources, comes in all forms of artistic expression: drawings, paintings, sculptures, objets d'art, silverware, but also in the sciences, geography, cartography, ethnography, botany, zoology, medicine, which generate books, cabinets of curiosities and collections, expeditions and natural history museums in Europe as well as in Brazil. The exhibition traces 400 years of history, from the Portuguese discovery of Brazil, through the Dutch period, the German, French, Italian and Portuguese expeditions and the long colonial history up until the Brazilian Empire of the 19th century and the beginnings of the Republic. "Terra Brasilis" focuses on several areas comprising key elements. The great discoveries and expeditions with an increasingly scientific approach. Plants and fruits with their various uses: gourds and seeds for musical instruments and ornaments, cotton for clothing or hammocks, pineapple, which made its appearance with great success in Europe, as well as confectionary obtained through the significant production of sugar cane. Coffee, cocoa, tobacco, cassava, maize and medicinal plants, which have found a use in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals. Birds, mammals and fish which are everywhere: pet parrots, toucans for decorating emperor's cloaks, hummingbirds on hats, feathers on arrows and weapons, armadillos, anteaters, jaguars, hunted for their fur, turtles, whales and crabs. Wood, precious metals, water, earth, which are also evoked through numerous works of art... The selected works come from both private collections and the National Museums of São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Belo Horizonte, Salvador, Recife or even from European Museums such as the Louvre, the Nationalmuseet of Copenhagen and the national museums of Portugal and Belgium.The problem of the vulnerability of this natural heritage and the sustainability of its use are of primary concern; the exhibition and the catalogue do not evade this issue.Tickets: Ticket Online op www.ing.be/art
item.address: Espace Culturel ING pl. Royale 6/ING Cultuurcentrum Koningspl. 6

item.title: Jean Dubuffet
item.body: This exhibition focuses on Jean Dubuffet's fascination for monumental art and architecture. It covers the extended timescale from his first commission for a public space to his monumental projects, some of which remain unfinished.The exhibition shows the artist's progression from drawing and painting to sculpture that became increasingly larger and more vast which then led to his grand architectural projects. The artist's plastic frenzied research appear logical and spectacular as the 2d form transforms into three dimensional architecture.With support of the French Ambassy in Belgium.
item.address: Musée d'Ixelles r. Jean Van Volsem 71/Museum van Elsene Jean Van Volsemstr. 71

item.title: Pierre Lahaut.
item.body: Honouring this neglected artist who is represented in our permanent collections, we celebrate 80 years of Pierre Lahaut, including the release of a special edition book dedicated to his work. As a member of the group Jeunes Figuratifs Belges in 1957, co-founder of the group Axe 59, teacher at St Luc's and La Cambre, he developed a career exploring painting in a variety of techniques such as pastel, pencil and watercolour. But his love for oil painting remained constant. As the years went by, his work continued to evolve into another universe, the abstract, but with a sensitivity and accessibility. He aspired to present a world which was soft and enigmatic, quiet and poetic.
item.address: Musée d'Ixelles r. Jean Van Volsem 71/Museum van Elsene Jean Van Volsemstr. 71

item.title: Poland in focus: Roman Polanski. Acteur et réalisateur
item.body: Presented in Poland, London, São Paulo, and at the Berlinale, this exhibition illustrates the career of the great Polish film-maker through photographs of the actor and director in full action, archive footage from collections held by his friends (Wajda, Kostenka, Gutowski and Nowak) and posters from the Lodz Film Museum.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Dinner’s served! From field to plate
item.body: A fascinating exhibition that asks today the questions for tomorrow. In 2050, our planet will have to provide food for 9 billion people. What are the stakes, how does the system function today and how is it to change in order to satisfy this demand by keeping, or rather inventing a fair allocation? An exhibition with a rich scenography. A multi-modal museography: graphic frescoes, audiovisual productions, exceptional items, photographs, electro-mechanical interactive displays, windows of discovery, tactile monitors etc. Contemporary art works mark out the exhibition halls.
item.address: Tour & Taxis av. du Port 86/Tour & Taxis Havenln. 86

item.title: Global Award For Sustainable Architecture 2007 - 2011
item.address: CIVA - Centre International pour la Ville, l'Architecture et le Paysage r. de l'Ermitage 55/CIVA - Internationaal centrum voor de Stad, de Architectuur en het Landschap Kluisstr. 55

item.title: Les choix des conservateurs
item.address: Musées royaux des Beaux-Arts de Belgique r. de la Régence 3/Koninklijke Musea voor Schone Kunsten van België Regentschapsstr. 3

item.title: Fernand Schirren
item.body: In keeping with the Royal Museums of Fine Arts of Belgium's desire to spotlight lesser-known artists, they are pleased to present an exhibition devoted to Ferdinand Schirren (1872–1944). Schirren, whose work is well represented in the Royal Museums' holdings, is considered to be the first Belgian Fauve. Schirren has, however, languished in the shadow of Rik Wouters, whose groundbreaking works have a central place in our holdings. But thanks to recent acquisitions, the Museums' collection of Schirren's works now covers all the phases of his artistic evolution, as well as the various techniques he used. He began his artistic career as a sculptor. His major work, completed early in his career, is a head of Helena P. Blavatsky, a crucial figure in the Theosophical movement. This astonishingly expressive portrait, acquired in 2007, is unique in Schirren's multi-faceted sculptural output, and visitors will be able to discover it during the show. The Blavatsky bust is in a monumental vein, and could be understood as an interpretation that incorporates aspects of the fin-de-siècle Theosophical movement. However, Schirren's abrupt shift to painting and drawing in 1904 introduces us to an early 20th century artist who gave pride of place to colour, which he used to render forms. By 1906, working in the quiet of the Brabant countryside, he succeeded in creating work reminiscent of the 1905 watercolours by Matisse, Manguin and Camoin, painted at Collioure. Based on Schirren's oils from 1904 and the 1906 watercolours – including one from the Museum's holdings that displays a sort of vigorous Tachisme – visitors will discover an artistic career that operated on two levels. In the drawings, and the watercolours in particular, Schirren immediately displays a consummate ease and a daring that does not appear in his paintings before 1917 and his masterpiece, Lady Behind a Piano. Using colour as the primary means for building an all-encompassing oeuvre would become the overriding theme in Schirren's work for the rest of his life. His sculptures, however, show his talent for working in "black and white" and his eye for form. Between 1910 and 1912, he worked primarily in charcoal and sanguine. These drawings – interiors, nudes and portraits – show the artist's great sensitivity and expressiveness. The sheer range of Schirren's work, including sculpture, painting, watercolours and drawings, ensure that every visitor will find something of interest. Schirren's artistic focus on the inner life, with his intimate watercolours of fugitive materiality, leads us on a journey through his imaginary gardens.Curators : Adrien Grimmeau Inga Rossi-Schrimpf
item.address: Musées royaux des Beaux-Arts de Belgique r. de la Régence 3/Koninklijke Musea voor Schone Kunsten van België Regentschapsstr. 3

item.title: Winter Wonders 2011
item.body:
The magical illumination of the Grand’Place, the Christmas market of the European regions in the heart of the city, the Baroque merry-go-rounds on Place Sainte-Catherine, the big wheel and the ice rink at Marché aux Poissons, dozens of stalls for stocking up on gifts and treats. Winter Pleasures is the perfect name for it!

Discover the program on the new Winter Wonders website !
item.address: Place Sainte-Catherine, Grand Place, Marché aux Poissons et autour de la Bourse /Sint-Katelijneplein, Grote Markt, Vismarkt en rond de Beurs

item.title: Wunderkammer. Cabinet de curiosités contemporain
item.address: Botanique r. Royale 236/Botanique Koningsstr. 236

item.title: Belgian Racing Legends
item.body: The exhibition : pilotes and cars !In a completely original style, the exhibition recreates the magical atmosphere of theracetrack, with its paddocks, terraces and unique atmosphere, and of course its finestcompetition cars (30 in total).On a mocked up track: some 15 cars placed in chronological on the starting grid.While in the paddocks and around the mezzanine: racing and rally cars. On the terraces,screens will display info about the drivers, their victories and their anecdotes.Not forgetting the video areas with period film screenings, photo galleries, posters, trophycupboards, etc.
item.address: Autoworld Parc du Cinquantenaire 11/Autoworld Jubelpark 11

item.title: Tram Experience
item.body:
The tram is part and parcel of everyday life in Brussels in much the same way as gastronomy is. Good reason then to involve the tram in Brusselicious in every possible sense. Which is why we are delighted to offer visitors the opportunity to discover Brussels aboard a rather special vehicle: a design furnished tram in white livery that will take 34 guests on a two-hour round trip taking in some of the most beautiful spots of the city as you savouring a succulent and surprising menu thought up and concocted by a star chef who delights in revisiting the great classics of Brussels gastronomy.

‘Spiffing' (to our British chums) and ‘Awesome dude' (to our American friends)! departures from place Poelaert for a 2 hour circuit – departures from Tuesday to Thursday at 20:00, Friday and Saturday at 19:00 and 21:30, Sunday at 12:00 - 34 places - all-inclusive single price of 75€ - reservations open soon on this website.
 
Leave us your e-mail address to be informed about the reservations
item.address: Place Poelaert /Poelaertplein

item.title: Djangofolllies 2012.
item.body: “Django did something that only a few could do; he was so exceptional that he was able to forge his own music genre (Gypsy swing). He was a virtuoso guitar player with a fantastic feeling for lyricism, structure and balance. His unmistakable genius lies in the way he so effortlessly combined jazz with musette and gypsy music to create masterpieces which have passed and will continue to pass the test of time. He is considered to be one of the most important musical icons of the 20th century.” (Waso De Cauter) The vzw ‘De Vrienden van Brosella' organises for the 17th time this unique birthday party to honour the birth of Django Reinhardt, in a coproduction with ‘Les Riches-Claires'. The festival will cover 14 different venues.
item.address: Divers lieux en Belgique /Verschillende locaties in Belgïe

item.title: Festival Djangofolllies
item.address: CC des Riches-Claires r. des Riches Claires 24/CC Rijke Klaren Rijkeklarenstr. 24

item.title: Art Truc Troc - 8TH EDITION
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Rosemarie Trockel.
item.address: Wiels - Centre d'art contemporain asbl av. Van Volxem 354/Wiels - Centrum voor Hedendaagse Kunst vzw Van Volxemlaan 354

item.title: Perrier Truc-Troc.
item.body: This really original one-day exhibition always attracts crowds to the Centre for Fine Arts. No money changes hands: visitors put post-its beside the work they want, offering everything from two tons of coal to a ten-year-old Saab to DIY services to a weekend in a holiday apartment.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Affordable Art Fair
item.body: Imagine a fair that looks like no other and welcomes you in a fab and funky atmosphere with almost 90 contemporary art galleries from Belgium and abroad.
item.address: Tour & Taxis av. du Port 86/Tour & Taxis Havenln. 86

item.title: Per Kirkeby and the forbidden paintings of Kurt Schwitters
item.body: The Centre for Fine Arts presents the unique work of the famous Danish painter Per Kirkeby (born in 1938). After taking part in Fluxus happenings, Kirkeby soon turned to architecture and to the natural world around him. A geologist by training, he depicts the great outdoors in paintings that border on the abstract, with a succession of layers and vigorous brushstrokes. Over the past 40 years he has employed a wide variety of techniques: painting on canvas and Masonite, sculpture in brick and bronze, drawing, monotype, and film. Keeping his distance from trends and fashions, he goes in search of what is essential. THE FORBIDDEN PAINTINGS OF KURT SCHWITTERS : It was in 1961 that Per Kirkeby, then a young artist, fell in love with the landscapes painted by the German artist Kurt Schwitters (1887-1948) when he was in exile in Norway in the 1930s. Schwitters is known for his Dadaist collages, but Kirkeby has drawn attention to another side of Schwitters, revealed in these works that that the Danish artist calls his "forbidden paintings", "works that do not fit in with 'history'". Kirkeby can identify with the crazy side of Schwitters – a craziness that liberates him from considerations of technique, style, or taste.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Anima 2012
item.body: The Anima international festival is THE rendez-vous for the latest in cartoon films, animation at its best, sharpest, weirdest and wildest. With over 200 screenings of all genres, some films not yet premiered, an Animation Night to remember, and to round off the event, award of the golden Cartoon d'Or, this festival has become a major event in its category. The mood is relaxed and magical, a week's holiday for fans and professionals alike.
item.address: Flagey pl. Sainte-Croix 1/Flagey Heilig-Kruisplein 1

item.title: La Belle Époque de Cheret
item.body: This Jules Chéret retrospective presents the evolution of his artistic career, from poster designer to interior decorator. In the later part of the 19th century and the first part of the 20th century, Jules Chéret influenced the artistic and literary world by taking art to the streets, thereby transforming the urban landscape. His artistic approach deeply captivated the impressionists and constituted a stepping stone to modernity.Furniture, painted decorative objects, mural prints, wallpaper, portraits and drawings are displayed alongside circus, theatre and commercial posters, books covers, cards and promotional material.
item.address: Musée d'Ixelles r. Jean Van Volsem 71/Museum van Elsene Jean Van Volsemstr. 71

item.title: Foire du Livre 2012
item.body: The first Brussels Book Fair was launched 40 years ago, and since then the event brings together a wide variety and large number of publishing professionals as well as numerous international authors.As a gigantic bookshop open to all themes (literature, social and political sciences, economy, science ...), the fair creates a dynamic environment and opens the dialogue around books (meetings, interviews, research,...)Innovation: a whole space dedicated to greediness.La Foire du Livre de Bruxelles is huge meeting space in a festive and interbreeded atmosphere.
item.address: Tour & Taxis av. du Port 86/Tour & Taxis Havenln. 86

item.title: Ars Musica 2012.
item.body: Ars Music ais one of the ten leading international festivals of contempory music. Each year it offers an opportunity to discover what is going on in new music in Belgium, in Europe, and worldwide.
item.address: Divers lieux en Belgique /Verschillende locaties in Belgïe

item.title: Museum Night Fever 2012
item.body: Museum Night Fever is an event where around twenty museums stay open until the early hours, attracting young people in huge numbers for an offbeat programme: a strong and sparkling winter cocktail of exhibitions, concerts, performances, fashion, workshops and DJs! And it's back on 3 March 2012 ... featuring museums as you've never seen them before, with a contemporary and unconventional twist! And for those of you who will still be brimming with energy even after the museums have closed their doors, the night will go on at one of the afterparties.
item.address: Divers musées de Bruxelles /Verschillende musea van Brussel

item.title: Surrealism in Paris
item.body: The core of the exhibition consists of paintings, sculptures and works on paper but, because the Surrealists challenged the traditional classification of artistic disciplines, composite objects, photographs and assemblages will also be shown.Surrealism is one of the best-known art movements of the 20th century and its influence is felt to this day. It is also the only avant-garde art movement of the first half of the 20thcentury in which Belgian artists, the most prominent of whom was René Magritte, exerted a decisive influence. Surrealism originated in Paris in the early twenties out of discontent with the gratuitous criticism of traditional art by Dadaism. The surrealists were ambitious. They wanted nothing less than to liberate the mind through art and literature and rebuild society from the very foundations upwards. André Breton formulated this ambition into several powerful texts and was the uncontested leader of the group. The experience of the First World War had clearly shown that man's uncontrolled delusions had ended in a spiral of self-destruction. The Surrealists had the idea that they could counter this derailment. In art, it was possible to vigorously question the prevailing worldview and liberate new, hopeful and constructive energy from the shackles of conventions and clichés. Art, of course, first had to free itself from the yoke of the unconscious habits and authoritarian principles. In their search for innovative creativity, free from common artistic principles, the Surrealists did not develop a uniform style, but demonstrated a multitude of diverse artistic achievements. To feed the poetic power of their imagination, they turned to psychology. The dream and the unconscious were explored because it was believed that the true meaning and motives of human behaviour could be found there. The Surrealists were not only radical in terms of their art. Even in the presentations of their work they radically deviated from all typical exhibition forms.
item.address: Musées royaux des Beaux-Arts de Belgique r. de la Régence 3/Koninklijke Musea voor Schone Kunsten van België Regentschapsstr. 3

item.title: Bocuse d'Or
item.body: The ultimate and highly prestigious gastronomic competition whose annual and itinerant 2012 finals are set to be held in ... Brussels as part of Brusselicious.Leading chefs from 24 countries will be going head to head for 2 consecutive days to land the victory and the trophy. The 12 best placed chefs in this high-powered culinary competition will enter next year's world finals that are invariably held in Lyon (France).
item.address: Brussels Expo Place de Belgique - Heysel/Brussels Expo Belgiëplein - Heizel

item.title: Brusselicious XXL - monumental scenography
item.body: The superheroes of Brussels gastronomy are coming to town. Ta-dah! Just imagine: giant Brussels sprouts, chocolate tablets, mussels, pints of beers and cones with chips, all creatively decorated, changed around, customised and rethought by artists with a very vivid imagination.As soon as the sun is back in the land, this monumental urban stage set will be hitting the capital's best known streets and squares, letting everybody know that Brussels is set to celebrate its love of food for the next year ahead.During the summer, all of these sculptures will be brought together in one giant exhibition. The venue remains a secret for now: all a question of making people's mouths water with anticipation ...- from 22.06 to 21.09 : exhibition in a single venue
item.address: Centre Ville /Centrum Brussel

item.title: Armes et armures du monde islamique
item.address: Musées royaux d'Art et d'Histoire - Musée du Cinquantenaire (MRAH) Parc du Cinquantenaire 10/Koninklijke Musea voor Kunst en Geschiedenis - Jubelparkmuseum (KMKG) Jubelpark 10

item.title: Eurantica 2012.
item.body: This indoor fair features collection objects presented by 150 antique dealers and art galleries from all over Europe. The eclectic range of objects includes furniture, sculpture, clocks, weaponry, glasswork, ceramics, art nouveau, art deco, coins, and pre-Columbian art.
item.address: Brussels Expo Place de Belgique - Heysel/Brussels Expo Belgiëplein - Heizel

item.title: Bruxelles Week-end Bienvenue
item.body:
What’s it about? It’s 20 quarters in Brussels celebrating! Residents, residents’ associations and several other associations have scheduled different festivities.
 
Select a district and a quarter and discover all surprising spots, the activities brought to you by your hosts, the secret gardens… They’ll be happy to welcome you during the weekend of march 24th and 25th. From the starting point in the quarter of your choice onwards you’ll discover one surprise after another.
 
All activities are free of charge and are open from 10 am to 6 pm on both Saturday and Sunday. How about spending the night in a hotel for next to nothing? Thanks to our partner Brussels Hotels Association (BHA) we offer discounts as off Friday the 8th. Discover the rates of all participating hotels here.
 
This event is an initiative of VisitBrussels, and aims to prove that there’s more to the city than just monuments and museums: the selected off road tracks coin different emotions and guarantee unforgettable tourist souvenirs you’ll find nowhere else.
 
Would you like participate? You can call for more informations on 02/370.61.14 or send an e-mail roch@windbag.be
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: Fashion in the 18th century
item.body: Could you tell the difference between a ‘robe à la française' and a ‘robe à l'anglaise'? Would you recognize a ‘justaucorps' or a ‘panier'? The museum has recently expanded its collection to offer an overview of fashion for men and women in the 18th century. The lace enhancing these sumptuous items will also be in the spotlight since the Age of Enlightenment is the Golden Age of Brussels Lace.
item.address: Musée du Costume et de la Dentelle r. de la Violette 12/Museum voor het Kostuum en de Kant Violetstr. 12

item.title: Brussels International Fantastic Film Festival 2012. (BIFFF)
item.body: An opportunity to discover quality horror, science fiction, and thrillers – films to get the adrenaline going and the heart beating faster. Past award-winners have included The Last House on the Left, Dog Soldiers, Dark City, Ringu, The Butterfly Effect, and Dark Waters.
item.address: Tour & Taxis av. du Port 86/Tour & Taxis Havenln. 86

item.title: Balkan Trafik Festival 2012
item.body: Balkan Trafik Festival has become a staple of the musical season at the Palais des Beaux-Arts. In partnership with the association 1001 valises, artists from all over the Balkans and their Roma and Jewish, offering traditional music and electronic songs orthodox Sufi song ... and of course, film, dance and other happenings!
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Opening of the Royal Greenhouses
item.address: Serres Royales Laeken av. du Parc Royal/Koninklijke Serres Laken Koninklijke Parkln.

item.title: Art Brussels 2012
item.body: Art Brussels invites a hundred art galleries to present the works of their protégés. The result is a diverse collection of many different forms of contemporary art. The works on show are affordable, which is a good thing given the current climate.
item.address: Brussels Expo Place de Belgique - Heysel/Brussels Expo Belgiëplein - Heizel

item.title: Queen Elisabeth Music Competition 2012 - violin
item.body: This competition that awards young virtuous pianists, violinists and singers is unique in the world, not only because of its importance, its influence, but also because of the difficulty of the tests, the prestigious jury, the strict rules (a rigid points system excluding any favoritism) and especially its originality.In Brussels, the "Queen Elisabeth competition" is the major cultural event of the year, with its excitement, its show and its surprises.
item.address: BOZAR & Flagey

item.title: Kunstenfestivaldesarts 012.
item.body: The Kunstenfestivaldesarts comprises a selection of artistic work created by Belgian and international artists: remarkable new works which translate a personal vision of the world today that the artists would like to share with audiences who are prepared to challenge and broaden their perspectives.The Kunstenfestivaldesarts is a cosmopolitan city festival. We are part of a complex network of communities that makes territorial, linguistic and cultural divides increasingly porous. The city is the environment “par excellence” in which this cosmopolitan society can be seen.The Kunstenfestivaldesarts takes place in Brussels, the only city in Belgium where the country's two largest communities live together. Several Flemish- and French-speaking institutions are involved in the project. Fundamentally conceived as a bilingual undertaking, it contributes to encouraging dialogue between the communities living in the city.The Kunstenfestivaldesarts also runs a series of encounters and workshops alongside its programme that are aimed at putting its artistic project at the heart of the city and the people who live there.
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: Festival of Europe
item.body: A declaration by Robert Schuman on 9 May 1950 marked a key moment in Europe's development. Having the European institutions here means putting up with demos and traffic restrictions for summits, but it also means you can visit their HQs. Full details on the website
item.address: Quartier Européen /Europese Wijk

item.title: Les Nuits Botanique 2012.
item.body: Opening of the musical festival season !
item.address: Botanique & Cirque Royal /Botanique & Koninklijk Circus

item.title: Belgian Pride 2012.
item.body: This annual event, celebrated around the world – in Brussels it now includes a parade, concerts, and shows – has its roots in the Stonewall riots in New York in June 1969, which grew out of a protest against police brutality to gays. Things have changed a lot since.
item.address: Centre Ville /Centrum Brussel

item.title: Zinneke Parade 2012
item.body: A colourful parade with actors, dancers, musicians and other creative "Bruxellois" will invade the town and throw a party for the Zinneke, symbol of cultural diversity in Brussels. An orchestra, giant puppets, hip-hop, theatre,... all kinds of entertainment are to be found at this biennial event.
item.address: Centre Ville /Centrum Brussel

item.title: Fête de la Musique 2012
item.body: De ‘Fête de la Musique' valt samen met de zonnewende, de langste dag van het jaar. Oorspronkelijk werd het in Frankrijk gevierd. Het initiatief kwam van de toenmalige minister van cultuur Jack Lang, op 21 juni 1982. Het concept werd door de jaren heen steeds succesvoller en kreeg een internationaal karakter: in maar liefst 340 steden in 110 landen, verspreid over de hele wereld, wordt de muziek al dansend en feestend vereerd.
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles et en Wallonie /Verschillende locaties in Brussel en in Wallonië

item.title: Brussels Jazz Marathon 2012.
item.body: The tried and trusted formula remains unchanged. Over three days, a range of famous and not so famous jazz musicians will perform on four open-air stages and all evening long in a host of clubs and cafes.
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: 20 km of Brussels.
item.body: Whether you're a jogger, an athlete, or anything but, this event has something for you. You could run, with 25,000 others, along the city's finest avenues. Or just watch, applaud, and stroll around the stands set up for the occasion.
item.address: Esplanade du Cinquantenaire /Esplanade Jubelpark

item.title: Posy Simmonds: essentially English.
item.body: Riddled with literary allusions, class clashes and repressed desires, the comics of Posy Simmonds are quintessentially English. Don't be fooled by her demure appearance and upper-class, cut-crystal accent. Her powers of observation are laser-sharp, her mimicry of accents and types stingingly precise. For years, hardly anybody outside of Britain had heard of Posy, unless they read her weekly Guardian social satires featuring the liberal Weber family or her children's books, including Fred adapted into an Oscar-nominated cartoon. But all that has changed with the tragic leading beauties of her murder-mystery graphic novels, Gemma Bovery and Tamara Drewe, in which she cleverly updates and reinvents novels by Gustave Flaubert and Thomas Hardy. The French edition of Tamara Drewe (Denoel) won an Essential Prize at the 2009 Angoulême International Comics Festival and in 2010 Stephen Frears adapted it into a highly successful film. The Belgian Comics Centre in Brussels is honoured to host her first exhibition of original art and unseen sketches to span her entire career. It confirms that Posy Simmonds, now widely translated and acclaimed, is no longer a secret but a national treasure delighting an international audience. Curator: Paul Gravett
item.address: Centre belge de la Bande Dessinée (CBBD) r. des Sables 20/Belgisch Stripcentrum Zandstr. 20

item.title: The Summer of Photography. House of Europe.
item.body: The exhibition will look at various aspects of landscape: the romantic outlook on nature, the climate in the 21st century, and the relations between town and country. In the context of the Summer of Photography, BOZAR has invited museums, galleries, embassies, and cultural centres to plan their photographic programmes for the summer of 2012 with the theme of landscape in mind. This kind of cooperation results in 35 exhibitions a year, organised with 26 partners in Brussels, Antwerp, and Charleroi, Belgium's most important photographic centres.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Festival Couleur Café 2012.
item.body: World music enchants some and irritates others. The organisers of Couleur Café take great care to offer us only the highest quality music, food, and visuals. There are also activities relating to issues such as sustainable development.
item.address: Tour & Taxis av. du Port 86/Tour & Taxis Havenln. 86

item.title: Ecran Total 2012.
item.body: In the summer months, a kind of torpor descends on the film scene and most cinemas offer only the most mediocre of American productions and returns. A welcome alternative is the Arenberg cinema, which has a long history of promoting art and experimental films. For three months in the summer it screens masterpieces of cinema, forgotten or otherwise, films d'auteurs that enjoyed a meteoric career, and challenging documentaries. There are also series devoted to past and present film-makers.
item.address: Cinéma Arenberg Galerie de la Reine 26/Cinema Arenberg Koninginnegalerij 26

item.title: Festival Midis-Minimes 2012
item.address: Conservatoire Royal de Bruxelles r. de la Régence 30/Koninklijk Conservatorium Brussel Regentschapsstr. 30

item.title: Ommegang 2012
item.body: Once more, Ommegang opens its doors to give you breathtaking folklore, magic and animations. More than 1400 performers will help you relive a history (1549, the procession of Charles Quint) under the vigilant eye of the director Giles Daoust who will oversee sound and light for the sixth year in a row.
item.address: Grand-Place /Grote Markt

item.title: Brosella 2011
item.body: Brosella Folk Jazz, also known as plain Brosella, is a two-day festival, held every year since 1977 at the Théâtre de Verdure, near the Atomium. Relatively well-known folk and jazz groups play in a festive atmosphere, sometimes more centred on beer than music
item.address: Théâtre de Verdure Parc Osseghem/Groentheater Ossegempark

item.title: Festivities for the National Day 2012.
item.body: The Fête au Parc celebrates the Belgian National Day with a whole range of activities organised by Belgian and European institutions and organisations. The police, the fire brigade, the army, and the Red Cross will all be present to explain their work. The day ends with a fireworks display.
item.address: Parc de Bruxelles / Parc royal /Warandepark / Koninklijk Park

item.title: Brussels' Flower Carpet 2012.
item.body: You won8223;t believe your eyes. When you pass through one of the seven entrances into the Grand Place, you will be presented with a brilliant spectacle. Stretchingout over 2,000 m2, the floral display will positively glow with sparkling colours arranged in subtle designs. This monumental work, an original and ephemeral creation, requires months of design and preparation but has been put in place in just one day. A hundred expert craftsmen follow meticulous plans; each of the begonias and dahlias making up this exceptional tableau has its exact place, in complete harmony
item.address: Grand-Place /Grote Markt

item.title: Design September 2012.
item.body: Design September offers a series of events about the topic of design in various places of the capital. A delight to discover the exciting world of design and learn about it through lectures, debates, visits to designers' studios, tours of galleries and exhibitions.
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: Heritage days 2012
item.body: This weekend, Brussels is one big museum. Every year, the Journées du Patrimoine focus on a different aspect of the Brussels urban heritage. A unique opportunity to see inside private houses, businesses, and public institutions that are otherwise rarely accessible.
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: Folklorissimo 2012
item.address: Grand-Place /Grote Markt

item.title: The European Renaissance and the Ottoman Influences.
item.body: On 29 May 1453 the Ottomans took Constantinople. News of the city's fall spread throughout Europe and fear of the Ottomans grew as they advanced towards Vienna. "Ottoman" came to be used as a synonym for "barbarian". But the approach of the Ottomans also coincided with the emergence of a veritable fascination with this exotic world and its luxury goods. Artists from every corner of Europe travelled to the shores of the Bosphorus; trade flourished, and so did cultural exchange, giving rise to a great number of works of art with links to the Ottoman East. The exhibition shows the lure of the Near East for Western artists and draws attention to the influence of the Islamic world on Renaissance thought.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Engaging Egypt.
item.body: Engaging Egypt explores 4 specific yet pivotal moments in the art history of Egypt where a marked shiftin artistic practice resulted from an encounter between different cultural traditions in there relation toEurope. The first chapter explores the art of portraiture in the Fayum area and the cosmopolitan worldof Roman Egypt. The second looks at the repertoire of figurative art in a globalized Ayyubid Egypt. Thethird section deconstructs paradigms of modernity through an interrogation of the relationship betweenEgyptian artists at the turn of the twentieth century and the international avant-garde movement. Lastly,the multidisciplinary moment of contemporary art practice is introduced proposing an Egypt thatmanifests itself as a state of mind, rather than a geo-temporal entity. Engaging Egypt pauses at 4 points ofartistic production from an ongoing process of adoption, adaptation, and ultimately of negotiation withthe familiar self and the foreign other.
item.address: Palais des Beaux-Arts - BOZAR r. Ravenstein 23/Paleis voor Schone Kunsten - BOZAR Ravensteinstr. 23

item.title: Nuit Blanche 2012.
item.body: The perfect occasion to discover “Brussels by night”! With concerts, theatre, exhibitions, guided tours, parties etc. - in all about 150 activities - everywhere around the city, you're in for a true “blank night”. All that's left for you to do is compose your own personal route...
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: Jan Fabre. Chapters 1-18. Waxes and bronzes
item.address: Musées royaux des Beaux-Arts de Belgique r. de la Régence 3/Koninklijke Musea voor Schone Kunsten van België Regentschapsstr. 3

item.title: Jordaens and the Antique.
item.body: After the successful exhibition Rubens: A Genius at Work (14.09.2007-28.01.2008), the Royal Museums of Fine Arts of Belgium in Brussels are planning a major exhibition on Jordaens and the Antique in 2012-2013. A second venue is planned from the end of February until the beginning of June at the Fridericianum (Museumlandschaft Hessen Kassel), site of the world-famous Documenta.Of the well-known Flemish trio “Rubens-Van Dyck-Jordaens,” Jacob Jordaens (Antwerp, 1593-1678) has been studied the least. The exhibition will present an entirely new picture of Jordaens. Instead of the painter of uncomplicated genre scenes – works like Twelfth Night, or The King Drinks, and As the Old Sing, So the Young Pipe – we find an artist intelligent enough to take over part of Rubens's market share with lively mythological and antique scenes.Loans of around 80 paintings and drawings, tapestries and sculpture from major museums and little-known private collections from Spain (Prado), Denmark (Statens Museum for Kunst), the United Kingdom (Glasgow Museum and Art Gallery) and Austria (Albertina), supplemented with key works from Brussels and Kassel, will offer the public lesser known yet unexpectedly engaging episodes from classical antique sources – from Ovid's Metamorphoses to Diogenes Laertius's Lives and Opinions of Famous Philosophers. As was the case for the Rubens exhibition, Jordaens and the Antique represents four years of thorough scholarly research and a major restoration campaign. In the years leading up to the exhibition's opening, the Royal Museums of Fine Arts, Brussels, and the Museumlandschaft Hessen Kassel will be restoring the masterpieces by Jordaens in their own collections.
item.address: Musées royaux des Beaux-Arts de Belgique r. de la Régence 3/Koninklijke Musea voor Schone Kunsten van België Regentschapsstr. 3

item.title: Festival des Libertés 2012
item.body: Framework of communications, protest and artistic creations, the "Festival of Liberties" is the global expression of our permanent action of defence of rights, liberties and values of the universal democracy.As political and cultural event, the festival proposes films, debates and conferences, concerts, theatrical performances and exhibitions to a large public.Symbolically political observatory of the situation of the rights and liberties in the world, the festival is also a place of testimony and convergence of the democratic fights.
item.address: Divers lieux à Bruxelles /Verschillende locaties in Brussel

item.title: Winter Wonders 2012
item.body: The city celebrates the end of the year with a large European Christmas market that spreads through the cobbled streets and squares around Grand Place. The downtown quarters are transformed with fir trees, a Christmas crib, music and special lighting. To add to the festive mood, there will be a ferris wheel on Place Sainte-Catherine and an ice skating rink on the Marché aux Poissons.
item.address: Place Sainte-Catherine, Grand Place, Marché aux Poissons et autour de la Bourse /Sint-Katelijneplein, Grote Markt, Vismarkt en rond de Beurs
